snippet: In an interview, Prime Minister Enrico Letta said the rise of angry populism could undermine efforts to build and strengthen the euro zone’s political and financial institutions.
abstract: Italian Prime Min Enrico Letta warns rise of angry populism poses the greatest threat to stability on the Continent and could undermine critical efforts to build and strengthen the euro zone's political and financial institutions; warning comes with European parliamentary elections less than eight months away.
lead_paragraph: In an interview, Prime Minister Enrico Letta said the rise of angry populism could undermine efforts to build and strengthen the euro zone’s political and financial institutions.

headline.main: Italian Prime Minister Calls Populism a Threat to Stability in Europe
headline.print_headline: Italian Prime Minister Calls Populism a Threat To Stability in Europe
